intro: Oxytropis hirsutiuscula, commonly known as the hairy goat's rue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Oxytropis hirsutiuscula is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils.
